it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core
Class Engine

java.lang.Object
  it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core.SimulationObject
      it.unipr.ce.dsg.deus.core.Engine

public final class Engine
extends SimulationObject

This class represents the simulation engine of DEUS. After the configuration file is parsed, the obtained configured simulation objects (Nodes, Events and Processes) are passed to the Engine that will properly initialize the queue of events to be run.

The simulation is a standard discrete event simulation where each event has an associated triggering time, used as a sorting criteria. The events inserted into the simulation queue are processed singularly one after each other, each time updating the current simulation virtual time.

The run method of the engine will process each event in the events queue until a maximum virtual time is reached or the queue is empty. In each cycle the first event of the queue is removed (the one with the lowest triggering time), the virtual time of the simulation is updated and the event is executed. If the event has some referenced events, those will be scheduled right after the event execution, in the same order used to define them in the configuration file. If the event is not oneshot and it has a parent process, than it will be scheduled for a next execution with a triggering time calculated according to the parent process strategy.

Author:
Matteo Agosti (agosti@ce.unipr.it), Michele Amoretti (michele.amoretti@unipr.it)

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Engine

public Engine(float maxVirtualTime,
              int seed,
              java.util.ArrayList<Node> configNodes,
              java.util.ArrayList<Event> configEvents,
              java.util.ArrayList<Process> configProcesses,
              java.util.ArrayList<Process> referencedProcesses)
Class constructor that initializes the simulation engine according to the parameters extracted from the configuration file.

Parameters:
maxVirtualTime - the maximum virtual time of the simulation.
seed - the seed used as the only source of randomness in all the simulation.
configNodes - the list of Node classes defined in the configuration file.
configEvents - the list of Event classes defined in the configuration file.
configProcesses - the list of Process classes defined in the configuration file.
referencedProcesses - the list of Process classes associated to the simulation's main cycle.
See Also:
AutomatorParser
Method Detail

insertIntoEventsList

public void insertIntoEventsList(Event e)
Insert an event into the simulation events queue. This method must be called all the time an event should be inserted into a queue, since it provides the automatically sorting of the queue by using the events' triggering time as criteria.

Parameters:
e - the event to insert into the queue.

createEvent

public Event createEvent(java.lang.Class<?> eventClass,
                         float triggeringTime)
Create a new instance of the event with the given class extracted from the list of events defined into the simulation configuration. The event triggering time will be set according to the given parameter.

Parameters:
eventClass - the class of the event whose instance should be created.
triggeringTime - the triggering time of the event.
Returns:
a new instance of the event with the given class, obtained through cloning.

                         float triggeringTime)

Parameters:
eventId - the id of the event whose instance should be created.
triggeringTime - the triggering time of the event.
Returns:
a new instance of the event with the given id, obtained through cloning.

getNodes

public java.util.ArrayList<Node> getNodes()
Returns the list of all instantiated simulation nodes. This should not be mixed-up with the list of nodes defined into the simulation configuration file; this list contains the nodes effectively instantiated by starting from the configuration file.

Returns:
the list of instantiated simulation nodes.
